titleInfo.title: 'File 34/5 Correspondence Regarding Salaries, Leave etc., of Egyptian and Syrian Teachers in Employment of the Bahrain Govt'

physicalDescription.extent: File is arranged in chronological order, from earliest at beginning of the file to most recent at end.

Condition: Formerly bound with treasury tags, the file's pages have been unbound and are now loose.Foliation: The file has an incomplete foliation sequence and a complete foliation sequence. In addition, some of the folios have index numbers circled in red or blue crayon. The complete foliation sequence, which should be used for referencing, is circled in pencil, in the top right corner of the recto of each folio. It begins on the front cover, on number 1, and ends on the last folio before the back cover, on number 101.

mods.abstract: This file contains correspondence between British officials that relates to administrative matters concerning the hiring, pay and travel (to/from Bahrain) of Egyptian and Syrian teachers employed by the Government of Bahrain.Of particular interest are the following:Correspondence between British officials and the Near East Arab Broadcasting Station in Jerusalem regarding the suitability of an Egyptian teacher to provide sports news to the station alongside his role as a sports teacher in Bahrain (ff. 59-66).A translation and original copy (in Arabic) of an article written by Mahdi Ahmad Ali, an ex-member of the Egyptian Educational Mission in Bahrain, that was published in the Muslim Brotherhoodmagazine of Cairo in 1948 (ff. 71-73, 75) .
